data.text:
During the New Year holidays, everyone has more time to relax. Some people prefer to spend their time actively, but others just want to sit at home and watch their favorite films. "Forum" offers the TOP 10 holiday films in Russian. Of course, you have already seen most of these pictures. But, as they say, classics can be reviewed several times.

Irony of Fate or Enjoy Your Bath!

This is perhaps the most popular film in the New Year holidays. The story of how a doctor from Moscow, Zhenya Lukashin, went on New Year's Eve with his friends to a bath, and then quite by chance ended up on a plane. Lukashin, by mistake, instead of his friend, flew to St. Petersburg, where he met his love. The premiere of this romantic story in the USSR gathered 100 million TV viewers. Directed by the Soviet film masterpiece Eldar Ryazanov this year died, but his films will remain with us forever. Let us recall that in 2007 the film “The Irony of Fate. Continuation" directed by Timur Bekmambetov.

Carnival Night

One of the most famous New Year's comedies of the Soviet era, directed by Eldar Ryazanov. On New Year's Eve, when the workers of the House of Culture are ready to launch a perfectly rehearsed entertainment program, Comrade Ogurtsov intervenes in the creative process. He has been appointed acting director. Ogurtsov categorically does not like the program of performances, and he decides to replace the “frivolous” numbers with more “serious” ones. Many people probably remember what came of it. And the song “Five Minutes” performed by Lyudmila Gurchenko became a popular hit. In 2006, the film “Carnival Night 2” was released.

Zigzag of Luck

This is another comedy directed by Eldar Ryazanov. Employees of the fashion studio Sovremennik are going to celebrate the New Year. They want to use public money from the mutual aid fund to organize a festive table. Suddenly it turns out that there is no money at the box office anymore. But the way out the main characters of the comedy still found. In this film, famous Russian actors play: Evgeni Leonov, Valentina Talyzina, Evgeni Evstigneev.

Wizards

Musical comedy-fairy tale directed by Konstantin Bromberg. The main character of the fairy tale, Ivan Pukhov, an employee of a musical instrument factory, must marry a girl, Alena, who works as a witch at an institute of magic. But the trouble is that Ivan has an insidious and influential rival... As it should be in fairy tales, in the comedy “Sorcerers” - good triumphs over evil. Starring: Alexander Abdulov, Alexandra Yakovleva, Valentin Gaft, Tatyana Vasilyeva and many other popular Russian actors.

Morozko

“Morozko” is a popular fairy tale film directed by Alexander Rowe. Once upon a time there lived a good, kind girl Nastenka. Her evil stepmother forced her to work constantly. One day, the stepmother decided to get rid of her stepdaughter and sent the girl into the winter forest. And there Nastenka met her beloved Ivan. But, if not for the help of the good wizard Morozko, the fate of the main characters could have turned out differently.

Evenings on a Farm Near Dikanka

This film adaptation of Nikolai Gogol's novel “The Night Before Christmas” was released almost 50 years ago. The action takes place on the eve of Christmas. A merry story about how on the Christmas night in the Ukrainian village everyone was beguiled by a demon and how the mighty blacksmith Vakula managed to overcome evil spirits.

Poor Sasha

Lyrical New Year's comedy directed by Tigran Keosayan. The film primarily tells about the difficult relationships in one rich family (the so-called “new Russians”). The daughter of the main character wants to rob the bank of her “new Russian” mother. The girl doesn't need money - she just dreams of parental love. Starring: Vera Glagoleva, Yulia Chernova, Alexander Zbruev, Olga Volkova.

The orphan of Kazan

The New Year's comedy appeared on screens in 1997. The director is the famous Russian actor Vladimir Mashkov. The young teacher Nastya decided after the death of her mother to find her father. However, it turned out that Nastya has not one dad, but three. This only happens on New Year's Eve. Starring: Elena Shevchenko, Oleg Tabakov, Valentin Gaft, Nikolai Fomenko, Lev Durov.

Happy New Year, Mom

The film tells the adventure stories of heroes, which are united by one main feeling - the love of mother. The film consists of five short stories. Funny and touching, lyrical and comical - each story tells the story of mother and child, the two closest people in the world.

Christmas trees

The modern Russian comedy “Yolki” is about the destinies of a variety of people from all over Russia. In the film you will see the stories of a taxi driver and a pop diva, a businessman and an actor, a snowboarder and a skier, a student and a pensioner, and even a migrant worker and the President of Russia. All the heroes find themselves on New Year's Eve in a very difficult situation, from which only a miracle can help them get out. The comedy “Yolki” became so popular that later “Yolki-2” and “Yolki-3” were released on Russian screens.
